chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
isPR 3 (fun _ fn _ : nat => S fn)

Premises:
isPR : forall n : nat, naryFunc n -> Set
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
pi1_3IsPR = let H : 2 < 3 := le_n 3 in exist (fun p : PrimRec 3 => extEqual 3 (evalPrimRec 3 p) (fun a _ _ : nat => a)) (projFunc 3 2 H) (fun c _ _ : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 3 (fun a _ _ : nat => a)
pi2_3IsPR = let H : 1 < 3 := le_S 2 2 (le_n 2) in exist (fun p : PrimRec 3 => extEqual 3 (evalPrimRec 3 p) (fun _ b _ : nat => b)) (projFunc 3 1 H) (fun _ c0 _ : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 3 (fun _ b _ : nat => b)
pi3_3IsPR = let H : 0 < 3 := le_S 1 2 (le_S 1 1 (le_n 1)) in exist (fun p : PrimRec 3 => extEqual 3 (evalPrimRec 3 p) (fun _ _ c : nat => c)) (projFunc 3 0 H) (fun _ _ c1 : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 3 (fun _ _ c : nat => c)
pi1_4IsPR = let H : 3 < 4 := le_n 4 in exist (fun p : PrimRec 4 => extEqual 4 (evalPrimRec 4 p) (fun a _ _ _ : nat => a)) (projFunc 4 3 H) (fun c _ _ _ : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 4 (fun a _ _ _ : nat => a)
pi2_4IsPR = let H : 2 < 4 := le_S 3 3 (le_n 3) in exist (fun p : PrimRec 4 => extEqual 4 (evalPrimRec 4 p) (fun _ b _ _ : nat => b)) (projFunc 4 2 H) (fun _ c0 _ _ : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 4 (fun _ b _ _ : nat => b)

filter010IsPR : forall g : nat -> nat, isPR 1 g -> isPR 3 (fun _ b _ : nat => g b)

pi3_4IsPR = let H : 1 < 4 := le_S 2 3 (le_S 2 2 (le_n 2)) in exist (fun p : PrimRec 4 => extEqual 4 (evalPrimRec 4 p) (fun _ _ c _ : nat => c)) (projFunc 4 1 H) (fun _ _ c1 _ : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 4 (fun _ _ c _ : nat => c)
pi4_4IsPR = let H : 0 < 4 := le_S 1 3 (le_S 1 2 (le_S 1 1 (le_n 1))) in exist (fun p : PrimRec 4 => extEqual 4 (evalPrimRec 4 p) (fun _ _ _ d : nat => d)) (projFunc 4 0 H) (fun _ _ _ c2 : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 4 (fun _ _ _ d : nat => d)

compose3_1IsPR : forall f : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f -> forall g : nat -> nat, isPR 1 g -> isPR 3 (fun x y z : nat => g (f x y z))
compose3_3IsPR : forall f1 : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f1 -> forall f2 : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f2 -> forall f3 : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f3 -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 g -> isPR 3 (fun x y z : nat => g (f1 x y z) (f2 x y z) (f3 x y z))
compose3_2IsPR : forall f1 : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f1 -> forall f2 : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 f2 -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 g -> isPR 3 (fun x y z : nat => g (f1 x y z) (f2 x y z))
Init.Nat.div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat := match n with | S (S n') => S (div2 n') | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div2 _%nat_scope
succIsPR = exist (fun p : PrimRec 1 => extEqual 1 (evalPrimRec 1 p) S) succFunc (fun c : nat => eq_refl) : isPR 1 S
compose1_3IsPR : forall f1 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f1 -> forall f2 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f2 -> forall f3 : nat -> nat, isPR 1 f3 -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 g -> isPR 1 (fun x : nat => g (f1 x) (f2 x) (f3 x))
Init.Nat.log2_iter = fix log2_iter (k p q r : nat) {struct k} : nat := match k with | 0 => p | S k' => match r with | 0 => log2_iter k' (S p) (S q) q | S r' => log2_iter k' p (S q) r' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2_iter (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
compose2_3IsPR : forall f1 : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 f1 -> forall f2 : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 f2 -> forall f3 : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 f3 -> forall g : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 3 g -> isPR 2 (fun x y : nat => g (f1 x y) (f2 x y) (f3 x y))

swapIsPR : forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, isPR 2 f -> isPR 2 (fun x y : nat => f y x)
Init.Nat.eqb = fix eqb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => true | S _ => false end | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => eqb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.eqb (_ _)%nat_scope
